alert.note: Alert for Baker County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 3:17PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Baker County through 415 PM PDT... At 316 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Antlers Forest Service Station to near Unity. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Unity, Unity Dam, Antlers Forest Service Station and Larch Summit around 320 PM PDT. Sumpter, McEwen and Phillips Reservoir around 330 PM PDT. Elkhorn Peak around 340 PM PDT. Mason Dam around 350 PM PDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
